Default Blog post comment mode. You can change this for each post individually later.

Send a notification mail on rejected comments. The Flux CMS comment spam protection tries hard to determine, if a comment is spam or not. If it rejects one, it's almost certainly spam and you most certainly don't want to be informed about that. If it's not sure, Flux CMS sets the post to moderated and you always get a mail then and you can then approve it.
After how many days captcha should be activated. (-1 = never)
As an additional comment-spam check, you can use the akismet service. You have to get an API key at http://wordpress.com/signup/ and insert that here.

If you want to use a Creative Commons license for your blog content, put the link to the license here. Eg. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/

Your geolocation. It's basically "Latitude, Longitude" (47.3798, 8.5275 for the Bitflux office). If you don't know your coordinates, go to Multimap.com, search your place and copy the data from the box on the bottom called "Map Information".
